intro: Logania exilis, commonly known as the slender logania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
